channel.title: 99% serverstatus
channel.description: well ive been on the 99% mark for nearly 1 2 weeks. anyone how to get back to 100%?

item.title: 99% serverstatus
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:363352”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=459607.msg3362931#msg3362931 date=1286557151]

100% = 100 per 100
You can’t have 100/100 if you missed a check ANYWHERE.

No, it rounds up to the nearest integer. For example if it were at 99.2%, it’d round to 99%; if it were at 99.5% or more, it’d round to 100%.
[/quote]I was just explaining the math to the person that was flaming Lin.[/quote]when did it appear i don’t understand the math here? lol…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:10, topic:363352”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=459607.msg3362729#msg3362729 date=1286522558]
100% = 100 per 100
You can’t have 100/100 if you missed a check ANYWHERE.
[/quote]

No, it rounds up to the nearest integer. For example if it were at 99.2%, it’d round to 99%; if it were at 99.5% or more, it’d round to 100%.[/quote]I was just explaining the math to the person that was flaming Lin.

Read full topic

item.title: 99% serverstatus
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:363352”]100% = 100 per 100
You can’t have 100/100 if you missed a check ANYWHERE.[/quote]

No, it rounds up to the nearest integer. For example if it were at 99.2%, it’d round to 99%; if it were at 99.5% or more, it’d round to 100%.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Moparisthebest said it rounds numbers off, so once it his like 99.75% or something like that it will just say 100%. It’s harder to get it up, then it is to get it down.

It's harder to get it up, then it is to get it down.
LOL

item.title: 99% serverstatus
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Ask yourself this: When a value is 100% of another value, what is it? You can get to a value such as 99.9999%, but no matter how hard you try, without that extra boost it will never hit 100% again (Unless of course, it is rounded up).

Read full topic
